questions.questionText: From which Asian language does 'salamat' came from?
questions.solutionText: These words were possibly brought by the Arab merchants and traders who came to the country in the 9th century.
questions.hintText: This language is widely spoken in Yemen, Algeria, Bahrain, Chad, Comoros, Djibouti, Egypt, Iraq and more.

questions.questionText: The first president of the United States of America is?
questions.solutionText: On April 30, 1789, George Washington took his oath of office as the first President of the United States.
questions.hintText: He was an American political leader, military general, statesman.

questions.questionText: Who is the Greek God of the Underworld?
questions.solutionText: Hades, in ancient Greek religion, is the god of the underworld.

questions.questionText: Who was the first man on the moon?
questions.solutionText: On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong made history by becoming the first man to walk on the moon.
questions.hintText: He was also a naval aviator, test pilot, and university professor.

questions.questionText: Whom did Cleopatra marry after her relationship with Julius Caesar?
questions.solutionText: Cleopatra eventually married Mark Antony, but their relationship also spawned a massive scandal in Rome.

questions.questionText: What was the name of the Greek Goddess of Love?
questions.solutionText: Aphrodite, ancient Greek goddess of sexual love and beauty, identified with Venus by the Romans.
questions.hintText: Born from the white foam produced by the severed genitals of Uranus.

questions.questionText: What is the oldest Philippine city?
questions.solutionText: "Cebu City or Cebu is the main center of Christianity in the Philippines. "
questions.hintText: "Known as the ""Queen City of the South""."

questions.questionText: In Which Book of the Holy Bible did the death of Moses take place?
questions.solutionText: In Deuteronomy 34, Moses died in the land of Moab, and no one knows his burial place to this day.
questions.hintText: The fifth book of the Jewish Torah.

questions.questionText: ‘A Brief History of Time’ is authored by whom?
questions.solutionText: Hawking wrote the book for readers who are interested in learning something new about interesting subjects.

questions.questionText: What did Ptolemy think of the shape of the earth?
questions.solutionText: Ptolemy accepted Aristotle's idea that the Sun and the planets revolve around a spherical Earth, a geocentric view.
questions.hintText: Used in Mathematics to describe a round shape.
